Message.Title: Net 10
Message.Msg: Sometime during the night my long term relationship with AT&T ended. My cell phone bill crept up and crept up until recently it hit 143.00 per month. I went to AT&T to see what they could do to save me some money, Without serious compromises to my service, they could only shave $20 bucks off my bill. I signed up with Net 10. I get unlimited minutes, data, and texting for only $45.00 per month. I am AT&T's worst nightmare.

Topic.Title: It looks like Obama wants to bankrupt America

Message.Msg: The reason is, Social Security was bought and paid for by the participants. Medicare is being paid for by deductions from SS benefits. SS has been expanded to include welfare and that part of SS should be discontinued and turned back over to churches and other private welfare organizations who do a much better job of detecting fraud. The government programs tend to encourage fraud because it creates job security for the government employees.

You will find the same problem with Verizon. They both use India to save $$$. What we need is Americans who will work for the same or slightly better wages. Only problem is, our government has made that illegal and pays unemployment benefits that exceed those wages.

We’ve got Mikenelson441 posting (all in a matter of a few minutes), some very useful and invaluable information, as follows: 40 posts saying “good report” Followed by 88 posts saying, “important report” I’m very moved by his brilliant financial analysis and advice and I’m so happy that you’ve permitted him to share it with us all. He’s certainly motivated me to act immediately upon his invaluable information, however I’m somewhat confused…which is better… a “good” report or an “important” report? Potential vast fortunes await your speedy response.

I didn't think I would ever agree with you on anything but I sure do on this. Yahoo should send them a bill for advertising and, if they don't pay, sue them to recover yahoo's cost.

Full service, Data, texting and internet. Unlimited minutes with same 3G service I had before. They port your old number over. Only downfall is the support. I caught up on all my ironing last night while I was out sourced to India's call center. LOL. was on hold for an hour. But saving $100 bucks a month is worth giving it a go.
awesome

Topic.Title: It looks like Obama wants to bankrupt America

Message.Msg: Both Soc. Sec. and Medicare are funded through the payroll tax, and both trust funds invest in US Treasuries. Soc. Security does not "include welfare". Other mandatory programs, including things like the VA, SNAP, TANF, HUD, etc, appear in a separate budget line. Soc. Sec. does cover disability. However, I am not sure why you think the government should take care of income for people in their old age but not health care or the disabled. The main difference between Medicare funding and Soc. Sec. funding is that Reagan raised Soc. Sec. taxes in the 1980's, making the program almost self-funding (as Roosevelt envisioned). The same was not done for Medicare. If your argument is that retirees have "paid into" these programs and thus they "earned" the benefits, we should cut out Medicare for current retirees and seniors (who chose not to fund the program for themselves), raise Medicare payroll taxes, and reinstate Medicare once the Medicare trust fund is solvent again. We should also lower benefits for current seniors until Soc. Sec. is completely solvent, and then reraise them once the boomers have moved through the system. That way, everyone gets what they "paid into". Younger generations do not have to pay for what boomers and current retirees failed to pay for. Right?

Topic.Title: It looks like Obama wants to bankrupt America

Message.Msg: Hello Ricky, The boomers are just beginning to collect on Medicare and SSN. Most of us have been paying into SSN all our working lives so we have paid in much more then we are likely to collect. Medicare, on the other hand, never was funded adequately. I can't wait until I can drop my expensive private health plan and get some less expensive Medicare. The biggest outlays for both are the so called 'greatest' generation. They paid very little in SSN and next to nothing for Medicare and thanks to 15 to 20 pills a day, are still hanging in there.

Topic.Title: It looks like Obama wants to bankrupt America

Message.Msg: I am OK with the cuts and fees you suggested, but not unless the government does something else about the stupid things they do, like the money to investigate why lesbians are fatter than non-lesbians are as an example. There are THOUSANDS of such stupid expenditures on which we waste billions (yeah I know the lesbian thing doesn’t cost billions, but rolled up the stupid things they spend money are do add up to billions). If they hadn't robbed SS to spend money on such foolishness, perhaps we wouldn't be having this conversation. As a matter of fact my health care costs were less before I had to go on Medicare. I had to go because the insurance companies say so and so do any employer run retirement health care plan. As for as your comments about Roosevelt, why do you never make the point that Obama has never had to deal with a true crisis like 9-11 as Bush did? You seem to forget that point and that the Democrats were all over starting up HLS and the waste that much of it has been. The few crises that Obama has created, and he did most of them, he has failed to find a reasonable solution. The President is again predicting failure over a budget compromise before they even hold a meeting. How engaged do you think he really is? Again he is signing, ‘if they won't give me what I want then we can't reach a deal’ and he is acknowledging that before negotiations even begin. If Harry had a set, he would do what is right, work out a deal within Congress and let Obama veto it, and then override him. Let him know he is the President, not King.
